page.title: 07COMMUNICATIONS IN DEERNESS
page.content: Postal and telephone systems operate in the Deerness area. The{Post Office is centrally situated and open daily, except Sunday, for many types of business which include Giro and Savings Bank. Each day, except Sunday, there is one{delivery of letters and {parcels.}Mail is sent to Kirkwall where it is sorted and mail going outside Orkney is sent by air the same day. A{British Telecom}network of underground cables covers the area and nearly every house is connected. There is one{public telephone}at Gritley next to the electro-mechanical exchange. A new microprocessor controlled digital system is due to be installed. There is no newspaper published in the area but a monthly newsletter of local events is compiled and circulated.
